metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3424 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s SGI GRU driver in theway the first gru_file_unlocked_ioctl function is called by the user, wherea fail pass occurs in the gru_check_chiplet_assignment function. This flawallows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges onthe system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3424` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161
linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-144.161
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-lowlatency - 5.4.0-144.161
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-69-generic - 5.15.0-69.76~20.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-144.161').
